Title: Technical Game Designer II - Riftbound: The League of Legends Trading Card Game
RoleDescription:
As a Game Designer, you will design, tweak, and optimize the player experience. Your analytical skills, player insight, and creativity aid in crafting in- and out-of-game experiences that engage and surprise players. You will collaborate with interdisciplinary teams and work with every tool at hand to innovate and iterate player-focused designs that'll delight millions around the world.
As a Technical Game Designer II on Riftbound, you'll be working in open design spaces to help define the direction of an exciting new gaming experience. As a Technical Designer specializing in systems and gameplay, you will be responsible for implementing rich features that will delight players around the world and keep them engaged. Youll design and implement tools on Riftbound.  You will report to the Game Director.
Responsibilities:

Understand the relevant audiences for the game, and from this, calibrate your design expertise to reflect appropriate taste for these audiences
Use data and sense-making to identify opportunities to improve the health of the game through cards
Articulate and consider a scope and depth of possible solutions, including possible effects, and collaboratively reach the best solution
Discover solutions conceptually through rapid prototyping
Implement card content and iterate on it through playtesting
Create tools and improve pipelines that amplify the quality and velocity of your fellow designers
As needed, act as a tools engineer no more than 50% of the time (generally closer to 35%, with some weeks at 0% and occasional emergencies near 100%)
Be a bridge between designers and engineers, and an advocate for both solid implementation and high design velocity 

Required Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in professional game design, or equivalent experience
2+ years of experience in professional engineering or technical game design, or equivalent experience
Proficiency with Python
Experience designing and implementing systems in large, ambiguous spaces
Experience leading development on features in a rapid development environment 
Experience with balancing product goals with design decisions

Desired Qualifications:

Professional experience developing in unreal
Professional experience developing in C++ or other early-binding compiled languages
Experience with both gameplay and systems design
Experience working on TCGs or other PVP strategy card games
Experience mentoring other designers

For this role, you'll find success through craft expertise and a collaborative spirit that prioritizes the delight of players. We will look at your past studies and experience, but for this role, we also look for dedicated people with a personal relationship with games. Title: Senior Manager, Content Production- Wild Rift Publishing

Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played video game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
As a Senior Manager, Content Production in Wild Rift Publishing at Riot manages teams that include senior level ICs, supports leadership through production expertise and advocacy, and contributes directly to lead the most complex craft executions. You will play a dual role as a leader and individual contributor, driving holistic planning and execution of seasonal content production. Build production plans that unlock and fuse with multiple teams across Riot, advise on budgets, track costs and capture savings with finance partners, manage timelines, stakeholders and partners to ensure successful outcomes for product and content.
Oversee every level of content creation whether you are producing directly or leading others across multiple concurrent projects.
Establish and elevate relationships with Wild Rift game and publishing teams, and collaborate across multiple disciplines, from aligning strategic vision to facilitating creative meetings for concepts to coordinating final release details with our localization teams around the world.
Lead innovation of Production workflows and establish best practices including hands-on process, tools and creative development to improve collaboration and communication and decision making related to content creation across Riot and creative teams
Leverage media expertise and seasoned industry relationships to negotiate deals with external partners and agencies that provide Riot with S-Tier quality services at fiscally responsible prices. 
Deliver industry leading quality on time and on budget, ensuring that all partners look forward to working with you again.
Evaluate our content, presenting new ways to improve our craft and our players experience with gameplay video and cinematic content.
Provide mentorship and career management to unleash a team of top tier producers

10+ years as a lead/senior producer (or equivalent experience) in games, marketing, agency, film, vfx or tv
4+ years Management/Leadership experience to drive decision making and level up craft
Bachelors Degree (or equivalent experience) in a related field
Expertise developing production strategies and managing schedules, budgets, staffing plans for creative and production teams, agencies and vendors
Expertise with Project and Creative Management tools (ie. Airtable, Ftrack, Frame.io) and DAMs (ie. Iconik)
Expertise in a variety of projects types such as Web, Mobile, Video, Brand, Developer Content, Community and Social Content, and Strategic Consulting

Experience with Launching Games and/or products in a live service model

Riots People team exists to help Riot make the best decisions about its talent. We bring our expertise to all areas of Human Resources including hiring, onboarding, learning and development, diversity and inclusion, performance management, benefits, perks, compensation, employee relations and off-boarding so that all Rioters can flourish.
We view ourselves as trusted consultants and advisers with a specific expertise in all things HR. Working in People at Riot enables you to redefine what effective HR practices are. As HR Business Partners, we are not a compliance function. Instead, we carefully listen to the problem spaces and work with Rioters to get to an optimal outcome. We re-imagine the employee experience so it resonates with our workforce and our leaders and enables them to flourish.
As a Manager, HR Business Partner, you will report to the Sr. Director, HRBP partner and you will guide a small team to provide HRBP support to your client groups. You will act as a strategic partner helping shape people strategies in ever evolving and growing businesses and functions. You will often play a role in large scale projects spanning multiple groups. You will also deploy People tools and programs ensuring global consistency and careful creation to make sure programs work for your population of Rioters. You will be the go-to resource for all things related to talent, ranging from performance management to total rewards. You will be a culture promoter and a deployer of tools and programs that turn Rioter potential into performance and results.
Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business leaders, senior People team leaders & key stakeholders to understand business objectives and develop HR strategies that support the achievement of these goals..
Utilize HR metrics and analytics to drive informed decision-making and provide insights to senior leadership.
Influence and inform organization design with an eye towards effectiveness and long-term business objectives and cost control and develop change management plans for important organizational changes
Drive performance management efforts, facilitating  calibration sessions, group specific training, communications, and ensuring consistency with the process.
Help develop forward-looking succession plans and other plans to address capability gaps and blockers as part of broader workforce planning.
Collaborate with the compensation team to to maintain fair and competitive compensation and job leveling (within the teams you support your group and across Riot).
Partner with L&D, D&I, performance management, comp, benefits and other COE teams to inform programs based on needs identified with your client groups and to support their rollout and efficacy.
Provide guidance and support on employee relations issues, assisting with investigations, and being a first contact for initial leave of absence and accommodation related questions.
Manage periodic audits of information systems records and work with disciplines and products to ensure data accuracy.
Lead a small team of HRBP professionals; coach, guide and develop a team with emphasis on career, employee engagement, inclusion and a focus on well-being.

Required Qualifications: 

5+ years of experience in an HR generalist/business partner or specialist role with progression.
Experience managing, coaching, mentoring HR professionals
Bachelors Degree in Human Resources Management, Business, Organizational Design, or relevant field; or equivalent work experience.
Excellent interpersonal, consulting, collaboration skills, and leadership experience.
Experience in project management.
Experience working with or supporting diverse communities.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience supporting teams in entertainment, publishing, gaming, or tech companies.
Understanding and experience with US and California labor laws.
Experience supporting a technology or engineering discipline.

Players form the foundation of our community, and it's for them that we continue to evolve and improve the player experience.
Riots Procurement team partners with Deal Owners to secure all goods and services needed. We apply policies that help mitigate risk while allowing for maximum value in our deals. From getting large projects approved and negotiating contracts, to tracking orders and payments, we help Deal Owners navigate the journey. 
As a Procurement Specialist, youll report to the APAC Finance Operations Manager. Under their guidance, youll partner with Deal Owners representing multiple areas of the business to research, evaluate, advise on, and execute buys for products and services that enable Riot to meet our daily operational and financial goals. Purchases will be assigned to you based on a categorized combination of equipment, materials, supplies, and services, allowing you to grow and utilize your area-specific expertise. An ideal candidate for the Procurement Specialist position is an astute, analytical, relationship builder who is a skilled negotiator and dealmaker.
As a Rioter in Seoul, youll join a tight-knit group of exceptionally bright-minded individuals who share our prioritization of player experience, rejection of convention, and passion for gaming. Riot Games Korea is dedicated to creating tailored player experiences that show local players they arent lost in translation.

Oversee and manage the purchasing processes from start to finish, including vendor management, bidding, sourcing, and contract review, with a focus on cost savings and process improvements.
Develop and implement procurement strategies that align with business objectives and support sustainable growth.
Lead the purchasing process for all company departments, ensuring compliance with established policies and procedures, and identifying potential risks and proposing new processes to mitigate these risks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their requirements and ensure that procurement activities align with business needs, providing strategic advice and guidance as necessary.
Develop and maintain relationships with key vendors to ensure the best quality, price, and delivery of goods and services, negotiating favorable terms and conditions.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with other departments and teams.

Title: Staff Anti-Cheat Analyst - Games Tech Group
RoleDescription:
Riot Anti-Cheat is a highly adaptive team passionate about their craft. We understand the player impact of cheating in games and are focused on setting the highest bar for the integrity of multiplayer games. As a Staff Analyst on Anti-Cheat, you will report to the Operations Manager. You will be involved with identifying, detecting, and actioning cheats and other nefarious abuses of third-party tools across Riot titles, protecting our games and handling resolutions for player accounts. You will help to lead Anti-Cheat in identification, detection, and prevention of major methods within the cheating ecosystem, as well as other intentional and nefarious impediments to a competitive player experience.
You will be proactive, measured, and innovative in using Riots state of the art technology to stay ahead of an evolutionary adversary. You are motivated to maintain and improve the integrity of Riot Games titles, fostering a competitive environment for our players. You're comfortable in being able to communicate with both players and internal stakeholders, being able to translate your subject matter expertise into tangible goals, metrics, and resolutions. Your expertise in reverse engineering, data analysis and automation, and modern game engines can enable you to detect and remove the most pervasive of threats to competitive integrity. You'll foster a culture of adaptability, persistence, and collaboration, both through your individual contributions and your leadership of large campaigns. 
Responsibilities:

Work with the Anti-Cheat team, across multiple disciplines, to identify, detect, and remove violators of Third Party Tools policies across Riot titles.
Investigate threats hands-on, integrating with cheat communities to acquire intelligence and software samples, identifying and labeling industry trends
Interface with samples of cheats, using tooling and reverse engineering to create accurate, effective detections.
Wrangle, interpret, and productionize data, automating accurate detections for cheat classes and other methods of abuse within Riot Vanguard ecosystem
Inform initiatives on Anti-Cheat engineering iterations, through subject matter expertise and large scale, consumable analysis
Represent Anti-Cheat in cross-team collaborations, informing game teams of best practices, creating processes to make design recommendations into actions.
Communicate with legitimate players about Anti-Cheat subjects, contributing to articles and other publications around the matter.
Lead Anti-Cheat Operations technical foundations, advocating and educating on best tech practices for the pod.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelors or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or equivalent job experience
6-8 years of experience in matters of game integrity, including attacking or defending it.
Excellent teamwork and stakeholder management skills

Title: Senior Researcher, WR
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience. 
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for players around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of players is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As a Senior Researcher, WR, youll join the Insights discipline  the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team and work closely with Rioters from other disciplines (designers, artists, producers, etc.) to conduct studies and analyses that will inform the features, systems, and experiences of our products. Your applied or experimental research background coupled with your deep understanding of data will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
As a Senior Researcher reporting to the Insights Lead on Wild Rift, you will be working across the Dev team, supporting the development of Live Features as well as incubation projects. You will independently identify and execute on research opportunities to support the development of new features or improvement of existing systems -- from prototyping through launch and live service. This role emphasizes a user researcher skillset -- including surveys, player labs, and market research -- to define the why for live and incubating features. If youre looking to leverage your research toolkit and collaborate with designers and product owners to craft resonant multiplatform experiences, this is an excellent opportunity for you.
Responsibilities:

Advise product teams by generating strategic frameworks and insights that guide the development of in-game and around game features for Wild Rift
Design and execute on surveys and player labs in Wild Rifts prioritized markets that support decision making by authentically representing player needs
Conduct global qualitative research and provide actionable guidance for the games team in terms of trends, emerging risks, and opportunities
Provide strategic insights to test design assumptions and inform products in development
Leverage storytelling skills to expertly share your results with other Rioters, League of Legends leaders, and partner studios
Collaborate with analysts and data scientists to construct holistic, multi-modal analyses

Required Qualifications:

BA or BS in the social sciences, marketing or a related discipline
6+ years of experience in user experience research, behavioral or cognitive research, or market research
Professional experience in survey craft and player lab design

Desired Qualifications:

Experience working across Game Dev and Product Marketing teams
Experience conducting market research or collaborating with market research vendors
Experience in product design or business strategy for consumer-facing products
Advanced capability in analysis software (SPSS, R, Excel, etc.)
Previous research experience on video games
